results.title: FI11 Pilots first flight
results.brief_description: Pilots and navigators trained to fly F111 aircraft, spend weeks mastering the process in a flight simulator and learning about the planes before becoming proficient enough to fly the F111 fighter jets. Trainee pilots become skilled in the performance of the F111 whilst the navigator trainees study the radar and navigation systems of the aircraft. This program documents the training process which results in the pilots and navigators first flight in the F111 jets.

results.title: Feverhouse
results.brief_description: Old and out of time, the monstrous architecture of the institution forms a world endlessly growing into corridors, courtyards, fire escapes, places of worship and discipline. Moving freely through the building, manipulating his puppets, is an unfeeling and intimidating force - thief who preys upon the inhabitants. The inmates and their world are completely inseparable. One inhabitant is a nurse, numbed and repressed by a place which, she knows, touches and disfigures everything it contains. She becomes obsessed with one of the inmates, a lost and blind archivist, impotent amongst his nightmare relics from ancient dead cultures. In a desperate attempt to form some perfect bond with him, she uses the thief as a go-between to lure him into a secret tryst.

results.title: Fever pitch
results.creator_credit: Wildgaze Films, Amanda Posey and David Evans
results.brief_description: Paul Ashworth discovers his passion for soccer when he accompanies his father to an Arsenal game. 24 years later, he still has the same passion, and is an unorthodox, deeply pessimistic thirty something English teacher. The highs and lows of Arsenal’s performance mirrors that in Paul’s personal life, thus the two worlds intermingle. Enter Sarah, and a relationship develops between two people that think the other one is either uptight or a soccer lout. As their relationship develops, Paul must question the distinction and importance between his personal life and his sporting fanaticism, as he is faced with the choice of deciding between following Arsenal’s first chance to win the championship in 18 years, or to pursue love. Cast includes Colin Firth, Ruth Gemmell, Neil Pearson and Lorraine Ashbourne. Based on the novel by Nick Hornby.

results.title: Feux follets
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jacques Bobet and Jean-Claude Labrecque
results.brief_description: Les Feux Follets (Will-‘o-the-Wisps) was founded as an amateur dance group in Montreal and developed into a professional group whose repertoire represents the folklore and the ethnic origins of the Canadian people. Two dances illustrate the group’s virtuosity - a Plains Indian Betrothal dance, and a more frenetic exhibition of the sixties “go-go” dancing. Choreographed by Michel Cartier; music Claude Poirier; sound by Ron Alexander, Roger Lamoureux, Bernie Bordeleau and photographed and edited by Jean-Claude Labrecque.

results.title: Fetishes, Heidi Fleiss, Chicken Ranch - The Nick Broomfield collection volume 1: adventures in the sex trade
results.brief_description: Three works spotlighting the sex industry in America, by notorious documentary filmmaker, Nick Broomfield. “Heidi Fleiss” is about the infamous prostitute whose clientele included many top Hollywood players. Includes interviews with Fleiss, her colleagues and friends about the proceedings that led to her court case. “Chicken Ranch” is the name of the best-known legalised brothel in America; this piece observes the day-to-day lives of the women who work there. “Fetishes” explores the functions of the S&M parlor ‘Pandoras Box’ and various aspects of S&M, corporal punishment, whipping/slapping, wrestling fetish, rubber fetish, infantilism, slaves, humiliation, mistresses etc. Includes vivid footage of the parlor in operation. Broomfield’s tendency to centre himself within the subject under investigaion is borne out in these works that, depsite this irritation, address compelling aspects of prostitutiuon.

results.title: Fetishes
results.creator_credit: Home Box Office, Nicholas Broomfield and Michele D'Acosta
results.brief_description: Pandora’s Box is an exclusive high class S & M parlour in Manhattan. Mistress Raven - previously a Long Island housewife, became New York’s most famous mistress and later retired to become the founder of Pandora’s Box. The documentary covers the functions of her parlour and various aspects of S & M; corporal punishment, whipping/slapping, wrestling fetish, rubber fetish, infantilism, slaves, humiliation, mistresses etc. The documentary provides insights into the personal aspirations of Raven’s crew of dominatrix (Mistress Natasha, Catherine, and Delilah) with vivid footage of the parlour in operation.

results.title: Fete a Coutances
results.creator_credit: Mary Glasgow Audio-Visual and Antony Barrier
results.brief_description: Describes the life of farmers and villagers in and around Coutances in Normandy. The documentary includes clips of conversations between inhabitants of Coutances, scenes of a wedding and of the 14th July clebrations. In French language.

results.title: Festliches Nuernberg = Nuremberg rally
results.brief_description: Coverage of the 1937 Nuremberg Rally. The film opens with views of Nuremberg immediately prior to the rally. Hitler is seen arriving in Nuremberg by aeroplane and driving through crowd lined streets to a rousing reception. Propaganda shots of factory production, farming activities etc., precede coverage of the rally itself. Shots of massed troops parading before Hitler are followed by a display of military weapons etc. The film closes with night scenes of the rally and a fireworks display. There is no commentary.

results.title: Festivals in Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Goang Jiann Enterprises Corporation, Weng Jeng-Yih, David J.C. Shih and Yu Ping Chung
results.brief_description: Chinese traditions, customs and festivals centre around the lunar calendar. In Taiwan, these customs and festivals take the form of a unique culture of temple fairs, each with their own local emphasis.

results.title: Festival time
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India, M. Bhavnani and V.R. Sarma
results.brief_description: The festivals, mostly of religious origin, celebrated each year in India including: Holi, the spring festival, marked by fights with colored water, open air performances of the Vedas, and dancing; Gokul Ashtam which celebrates the birth of Lord Krishna; Ganesh, devoted to the god of wisdom; Dusserah, the autumn harvest festival when womanhood is venerated, books and tools of trade are worshipped in thanks for a livelihood and demon effigies are set on fire; Divala, festival of the goddess of wealth, a festival of lights and a special occasion for the trading community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Documentary Films of India, M. Bhavnani and V.R. Sarma
